Theoretical background¶

Lorenz-Mie Theory (LMT)¶

Here some usefull relations:

Calculates S1 and S2 at μ=cos(θ), where θ is the scattering angle.

S1 and S2 are calculated by:

\({\displaystyle S_1=\sum\limits_{n=1}^{n_{max}}\frac{2n+1}{n(n+1)}(a_n\pi_n+b_n\tau_n)}\)

\({\displaystyle S_2=\sum\limits_{n=1}^{n_{max}}\frac{2n+1}{n(n+1)}(a_n\tau_n+b_n\pi_n)}\)

Computes Mie efficencies Q and asymmetry parameter g of a single, homogeneous particle:

\({\displaystyle Q_{sca}=\frac{2}{x^2}\sum_{n=1}^{n_{max}}(2n+1)(|a_n|^2+|b_n|^2)}\)

\({\displaystyle Q_{ext} = \frac{2}{x^2} \sum_{n=1}^{n_{max}} \frac{(2n+1)}{\mathcal Re \{ a_n+b_n \}}}\)

\(Q_{abs}=Q_{ext}-Q_{sca}\)

\({\displaystyle a_n = \frac{\mu_{sp} \Psi_n(\alpha) \Psi_n^\prime(\beta) - \mu M \Psi_n^\prime(\alpha) \Psi_n(\beta)} {\mu_{sp} \xi_n(\alpha) \Psi_n^\prime(\beta)- \mu M \xi_n^\prime (\alpha) \Psi_n(\beta)} }\)

\({\displaystyle b_n = \frac{\mu M \Psi_n(\alpha) \Psi_n^\prime(\beta) -\mu_{sp} \Psi_n^\prime(\alpha) \Psi_n(\beta)} {\mu M \xi_n(\alpha) \Psi_n^\prime(\beta)-\mu_{sp} \xi_n^\prime (\alpha) \Psi_n(\beta)} }\)

\({\displaystyle c_n = \frac{\mu_{sp} M \big[ \xi_n(\alpha) \Psi_n^\prime(\alpha) - \xi_n^\prime(\alpha) \Psi_n(\alpha) \big]} {\mu_{sp} \xi_n(\alpha) \Psi_n^\prime(\beta)- \mu M \xi_n^\prime (\alpha) \Psi_n(\beta)} }\)

\({\displaystyle d_n = \frac{ \mu M^2 \big[ \xi_n(\alpha) \Psi_n^\prime(\alpha) -\xi_n^\prime(\alpha) \Psi_n(\alpha) \big]} {\mu M \xi_n(\alpha) \Psi_n^\prime(\beta)-\mu_{sp} M \xi_n^\prime (\alpha) \Psi_n(\beta)} }\)
